description.narrative: To improve the ease of doing business processes in Malawi in order to increase foreign and domestic private sector investment in the economy.

condition.narrative: Establish the public-private sector dialogue secretariat referred to in Part B.4 of the Project.
Publish the bill relating to the establishment of Malawi Investment and Trade Center, under Part B.1 of the Project.
Publish the bill relating to the legal and institutional framework for public-private partnerships, under Part B.2 of the Project.

title.narrative: Reduction of turnover in firms accessing Business Growth Scheme (BUGS).

comment.narrative: A consultant is in the process of being engaged and work is due to start in April, 2011 to do a study to establish this indicator.

title.narrative: Growth of turnover in firms accessing Business Growth Scheme(BUGS)

comment.narrative: A similar study is expected to be done towards the end of the project to establish end target.
A consultant is in the process of being engaged and work is due to start in April, 2011 to do a study to establish this indicator.

title.narrative: Reduction in time taken to register property title.

comment.narrative: There has not been much progress over past three years but procedures have been streamlined in past year and impact assessmentindicated improvement in commercial city of Blantyre but not at national level. Automation of lands registry to be carried out in2011 should be positive impact in reduction in time.

title.narrative: Reduction of costs to formally start a business by end of project

comment.narrative: This has remained the same from the 2011 DB Report.

title.narrative: Reduction of time taken to obtain licences and permits.

comment.narrative: This indicator has not changed according to the 2012 DB Report. Working with the IFC under BESTAP, a mapping study of obtaininglicenses in Malawi was carried out in 2010 and recommendations are being implemented led by Commissioner of Physical Planning.

title.narrative: Reduction in time taken to settle commercial disputes.

comment.narrative: The Commercial Court has made substantial progress from the 337 days it used to take when the project started.

title.narrative: Reduction in time taken to formally start a business.

comment.narrative: According to the DB Report, this indicator has not improved. The expectation is that computerization and systems improvement beingcarried out at business registry will have significant impact on this indicator as well as new Single Business License Bill.

title.narrative: Legislative backlog of laws impacting cost of doing business reduced from 40 to 22 Bills by mid term review and cleared by end of project

comment.narrative: Tremendous progress has been achieved on backlog and laws that been reviewed and submitted, mostly due to legaldraftsperson/consultant engaged by BESTAP who works on reviews on a full time basis

title.narrative: Volume of Bank Support: Institutional Development - SME
